com.evernote.android.job

Class Job

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.evernote.android.job.Job
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DailyJob

    public abstract class Job
extends Object
    Base class for running delayed jobs. A Job is executed in a background thread.

    • Method Detail

      • onRunJob

        @NonNull
 @WorkerThread
protected abstract Job.Result onRunJob(@NonNull
                                                               Job.Params params)
        This method is invoked from a background thread. You should run your desired task here. This method is thread safe. Each time a job starts executing a new instance of your Job is instantiated. You can identify your Job with the passed params.

        You should call isCanceled() frequently for long running jobs and stop your task if necessary.

        A PowerManager.WakeLock is acquired for 3 minutes for each Job. If your task needs more time, then you need to create an extra PowerManager.WakeLock.
        Parameters:
        params - The parameters for this concrete job.
        Returns:
        The result of this Job. Note that returning Job.Result.RESCHEDULE for a periodic Job is invalid and ignored.

      • onCancel

        protected void onCancel()
        This method is intended to be overwritten. It is called once when the job is still running, but was canceled. This can happen when the system wants to stop the job or if you manually cancel the job yourself. It's a good indicator to stop your work and maybe retry your job later again. Alternatively, you can also call isCanceled().
        See Also:
        isCanceled()

      • runJob

        final Job.Result runJob()

      • onReschedule

        @WorkerThread
protected void onReschedule(int newJobId)
        This method is called if you returned Job.Result.RESCHEDULE in onRunJob(Params) and the Job was successfully rescheduled. The new rescheduled JobRequest has a new ID. Override this method if you want to be notified about the change.
        Parameters:
        newJobId - The new ID of the rescheduled JobRequest.

      • meetsRequirements

        protected boolean meetsRequirements()
        Checks all requirements for this job. It's also possible to check all requirements separately with the corresponding methods.
        Returns:
        Whether all set requirements are met.

      • meetsRequirements

        boolean meetsRequirements(boolean checkRequirementsEnforced)

      • isRequirementChargingMet

        protected boolean isRequirementChargingMet()
        Returns:
        false if the Job requires the device to be charging and it isn't charging. Otherwise always returns true.

      • isRequirementDeviceIdleMet

        protected boolean isRequirementDeviceIdleMet()
        Returns:
        false if the Job requires the device to be idle and it isn't idle. Otherwise always returns true.

      • isRequirementBatteryNotLowMet

        protected boolean isRequirementBatteryNotLowMet()
        Returns:
        Whether the battery not low requirement is met. That's true either if it's not a requirement or if the battery actually isn't low. The battery is low, if less than 15% are left and the device isn't charging.

      • isRequirementStorageNotLowMet

        protected boolean isRequirementStorageNotLowMet()
        Returns:
        Whether the storage not low requirement is met. That's true either if it's not a requirement or if the storage actually isn't low.

      • isRequirementNetworkTypeMet

        protected boolean isRequirementNetworkTypeMet()
        Returns:
        false if the Job requires the device to be in a specific network state and it isn't in this state. Otherwise always returns true.

      • setRequest

        final Job setRequest(JobRequest request,
                     @NonNull
                     Bundle transientExtras)

      • getParams

        @NonNull
protected final Job.Params getParams()
        Returns:
        The same parameters like passed to onRunJob(Params).

      • setContext

        final Job setContext(Context context)

      • getContext

        @NonNull
protected final Context getContext()
        Returns:
        The Context running this Job. In most situations it's a Service. If this context already was destroyed for some reason, then the application context is returned. Never returns null.

      • cancel

        public final void cancel()
        Cancel this Job if it hasn't finished, yet.

      • cancel

        final boolean cancel(boolean deleted)

      • isCanceled

        protected final boolean isCanceled()
        Returns:
        true if this Job was canceled.

      • isFinished

        public final boolean isFinished()
        Returns:
        true if the Job finished.
